Sodeta Boots.lore: These boots were standard issue to members of the prestigious, and now disbanded, Sodeta Guild, and given as a gift to the owners of Delnar Mansion one day.

Cerid's Ingenuity.lore: One of the master tinkerer Cerid's greatest inventions, these odd gear-laced boots clink and chime with the sound of clockworks keeping its powerful magic dynamos constantly running.

Fragile Truce.lore: The enemy of your enemy is your friend. It’s naught but a ceasefire of convenience, if not necessity, yet it’s a chance to lick your wounds and focus your might against the threat at hand.

Hephaestus-Forged Sabatons.lore: Honoring a mythical dwarven smith lost to the legends, these ornately-crafted boots are given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.

Bad Wolf.lore: The runic message carved on these enigmatic boots cover hundreds of different languages, many of them disused, but what has been translated seems to describe a disaster soon to arrive to the world.

majorIds.Lightweight: +Lightweight: You no longer take fall damage.

Steamjet Walkers.lore: A rogue inventor stole the plans for a steam jet booster from Corkus and reverse engineered them onto a set of boots. While effective, they are dangerous, prone to catastrophic failure.

majorIds.Cavalryman: +Cavalryman: You may cast spells and attack with a -30% damage penalty while on a horse.
+Cavalryman: You may cast spells and attack with a -30% damage penalty while on a horse.

Abysso Galoshes.lore: Rumored to be crafted from a Dernic stone, these sinister boots radiate extremely powerful dark energy. They have absorbed the power of the raging seas in their time locked in Sarnfic.

Withstand.lore: Despite the valley being overtaken by anomalous forces, the toughest flora has managed to avoid extinction. Their coiling vines and roots remind you that even in the most dire of situations, you will never go quietly.

Stardew.lore: Wybels have a strange attraction to cosmic magic, and many an owner will find them staring through the window at night. One, however, claims to have seen her Wybel making something out of white stardust. The abode was robbed shortly after, and the supposed item gone missing without confirmation of its existence.

majorIds.Lunge: +Lunge: Hop and Leap's horizontal velocity is greatly increased.

majorIds.Entropy: +Entropy: Meteor falls three times faster.

majorIds.Lightweight: +Lightweight: You no longer take fall damage.

Passus Lux.lore: A brilliant relic supposedly originating from the Realm of Light, the creators of these strangely shaped boots are completely unknown.

Omnitread Boots.lore: Plated with enchanted metals, these magic-warding boots allow faster travel over nearly any solid surface.

Enhanced Skeleton Boots.lore: Some of the bones used to make the frame of the boots have crumbled. The merchant refuses to comment.

majorIds.Lightweight: +Lightweight: You no longer take fall damage.

Seven-League Boots.lore: Bending the fabric of reality to allow the wearer to take massive strides, these boots are rumored to contain rogue djinni to power them.

Radiation.lore: Radioactive emissions caused by starfall seeps into the mind, the atoms, the Soul. Transfiguring organic matter into something new, something sinister. It's only through sheer force of will that victims of such a thing break free from themselves, and their imperfect vessels... into something beautiful.

Warchief.lore: Sheer strength exudes from these Orcish relics, simple sandals ill-fitting to humans or Villagers. Enchanted with power and rage rather than magic, the strength that is provided when they are worn is unparalleled.

Meanderthal.lore: These boots were retrieved from a frozen man, uncovered on an expedition to Mt. Wynn. It is believed that the man had been wandering the world before his death.

Crusade Sabatons.lore: One of the very few physically-powerful artifacts of the Villagers, these boots were used in the initial crusades against the Green-skins, to overpower the Orcs via raw physical might. Though effective, they have not seen use in a long time.

Ventus Tail.lore: Fashioned from the cut tails of the now extinct Venti, these nearly immaterial boots are light as air and crackle with lightning.

Disco.lore: Recovered from a corrupted soldier who wore them, it was found dancing instead of attacking those around it. Even after it was killed, it jostled and jerked around like a dancing puppet.

Enhanced Gypsum.lore: The merchant launched into a tirade on how the hardness scale of stones means nothing the instant you saw part of the boots flake off upon being touched.

The Swarm.lore: The scratching in the walls is the only warning you get.

Martingale.lore: Every power has its costs, and every triumph has its toll. Wager everything you treasure—it will all be worth in the end.

Enhanced Coalwalkers.lore: Even ignoring the numerous scorches all over, these boots hardly look any better.

Stingy.lore: "You should see when the spiders fight over a meal. It looks ridiculous, legs flailing everywhere!" -Captain Enduyn, Ragni Legion 1st Division

Enhanced Oxford.lore: They look like at once point they may have been fairly upscale. Now they just look like a metallic mess.

Mazeweaver.lore: The strong can hammer foe and nature alike into submission, waging war with indiscriminate force. The truly powerful pit them against each other on a whim, weaving stone and verdure into an elaborate web of attrition that beats with the heart of an entire world. What is an enemy compared to all the might of the Earth?

Resurgence.lore: An antique passed from the Caritat wreckage into the hands of the outcast elves of Efilim. So to honor the memory of the selfless family as inspired their self-imposed exile, their strongest healing spells were imbued into it, and sent to those who needed them most.

Giant Step.lore: Found in a mystically-charged Giant ruin, these snug boots recall fond memories, incite calmness, and provide comfort for the wearer.

Slayer.lore: Many artifacts are found to incite rage in the wearer, and wizards old and new alike conjecture as to the purpose of them. Very few increase the latent abilities of the wearers to ensure havoc, and none to such a degree as these boots.

majorIds.Taunt: +Taunt: Provoke's Cooldown is lowered by -3s.

Audacity.lore: A powerful mental curse surrounds these boots, inciting uncontrollable rage into the wearers, as well as the power to enact it upon others.

Cyclo.lore: A centuries-old storm spirit was banished to these tight boots for his destructive actions. His fury empowers those who wear them with the great force of a raging cyclone.

Broken Balance.lore: Torn scraps of metal line the inside of these boots. They provide no protection, instead forcing a constant adrenaline rush while worn.

Valse Vaincue.lore: The Wanderer; the Betrayer; the Lunatic.

Stalagmites.lore: Although these boots are crafted from corrupted stone, they do not exhibit any corruptive effects on their wearers. Speculation abounds as to the reason.

majorIds.Plague: +Plague: Poisoned mobs spread their poison to nearby mobs.

Equinox Blossom.lore: Perennial, in a sense—these plants cycle through a unique bloom for every season. When they fully form, the breathtaking equinox is said to shine with an otherworldly light.

Galleon.lore: Forged with the raw powers of both the earth and the sea, these boots were initially an attempt at creating a method of foot-travel over the seas. Despite the spectacular failure of that application, they remain a formidable and reliable set of armor.

Hunger.lore: Forgotten long ago, these boots curse the wearer with an endless hunger.

Snowtread Boots.lore: According to the tag on the heels, these boots leave a trail of snow no matter  where one walks with them.

majorIds.Snowy Steps: +Snowy Steps: Leaves a trail of snow behind you.

Anchoryl.lore: Despite being a much smaller settlement compared to the mighty citadel of Rodoroc, the dwarven smiths of Thanos still can forge mighty products, such as these heavy diamond-alloy boots.

Nether's Scar.lore: Forged directly from the bloody red stone mined from the Nether, they were locked away for fear of inciting insanity in those who wore them.

Ephemeris.lore: A pair of glowing sabatons crafted from time-lost relics. Somehow, despite just creating them, you get the feeling that you've worn these before...

Boreal.lore: The last known crafts of Theorick before his fall in battle were pieces of armour crafted out of pure ice, all of which have melted save for these shimmering boots. The coldest gales and most suffocating heat nurture and repair the wearer instead of being stifling or deadly.

Scorpio.lore: The carapace of the common Maexi pet fire scarabs, while alone, only cause minor burns to the touch. However, when woven together, they produce a variety of cumulative effects.

Gaea-Hewn Boots.lore: Forged in direct tribute to the earth and its aspects, these ornately-crafted boots are given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.

Almuj's Walker.lore: There used to be a constant battle between Almuj's thieves over these feather-light, gold-plated boots, until one day they were stolen by an unknown pickpocket and never seen again.

majorIds.Escape Route: +Escape Route: Frenzy and Time Dilation charge twice as fast, but to a halved maximum.

Mud.lore: "Some pigmen snuffle through dirt for things to eat. We dig up that soil to plant our crops in; it's always full of life." -Thomas, Ravine Village Resident

Dawnbreak.lore: Many prophecies foretell of new eras. Most are fabricated or proven false in time. One passed through the Dogun caverns, however, tells of a dawn soon to break, in which the earth shall run red and return to flame. Fanatical sects whisper the coming of a new demonic god.

Phage Pins.lore: Salvaged from the limbs of the Vulcor Adrenophage, they radiate extreme heat,  suffusing the body they attach to with that same heat. It almost feels as though your blood is heating to a frenetic boil.

majorIds.Paragon: +Paragon: Shield Strike deals 300% damage. Mantle of the Bovemist's cooldown is reduced by 15s, but is limited to one shield charge.

Aphorism.lore: Just because it's been said to death doesn't mean it isn't true.

Virgo.lore: These common leather boots were once owned by a barbarian with no magical prowess. Instead of enchanting it, he coated the soles in corrupted shards to punish those who opposed him.

Lingering Twilight.lore: In the harshest reaches of the mountains, dusk brings a gentle magic to the air, prolonging the faintest vestiges of sundown before night truly falls.

majorIds.Dead Weight: +Dead Weight: Totem's horizontal velocity is greatly increased at the cost of vertical movement.

Memento.lore: All those who wear these enchanted boots deposit a single fond memory into them. They are forgotten forever, but wearing them recalls every memory within vividly.

Moontower.lore: For the belief of the cosmos’ defilement, the moon was noted to remain unchanged. Those with this belief live only for the light of the moon, desperately seeking to maintain it through means that would only darken the soul of the most devout. Such from them comes the word lunacy.

Capricorn.lore: During a spiritual journey to Kato temple, the sage Capian was presented with powerful spiritual boots with the intention to be used for peaceful magic, and not hard combat.

Revenant.lore: Those whose souls are lost to the Canyon of the Lost eternally seek form. They inhabit those who wear these boots, unknowingly dragging the soul of the wearer into their ranks if worn for too long, leaving a wandering husk.
